build I20040511 

1) opened a workspace that had the following checked 
org.eclipse.core.filebuffers
org.eclipse.jface
org.eclipse.platform
org.eclipse.swt
org.eclipse.swt.win32
org.eclipse.ui
org.eclipse.ui.editors

org.eclipse.ui.versioncheck

org.eclipse.ui.workbench.texteditor
TESTS

1b) worked for a while 1 hour of development, running innerworkspaces 
occasionally (also, this is not a new workspace)
2) checked out
   org.eclipse.ant.optional.junit
   org.eclipse.test
2b) wait till done
3) checked out
    org.eclipse.swt
    org.eclipse.swt.win32
4) while the CVS check was running in the background, selected
   org.eclipse.ant.optional.junit
   org.eclipse.test
projects and poped up a menu and chose export, 
tried to export these two plug-ins to a "Deployable Plug-in and Fragment" zip 
file

5) the export failed with the following error (see below).  What is strange is 
that I did not select SWT for export.. .it appears that that the registry is 
not in a good state at this time.  

6) after this occurred I found that the package explorer was not up-to-date as 
when I expanded an item (org.eclipse.ui.workbench), it showed the contents of 
the item two places above it.

When the error for the failure to export opens it has the same message for 
Ant Build: and Reason: ... this is not a usefull thing.  The code should not 
show the reason if it does not have one.

see bug 62117

PDE Build is not job aware. So far, given that pde build is only being invoked
through pde ui, the responsibility has been left to pde ui.

I tried with I20040513-1600 and I could not reproduce the problem. It looks like
pde ui fixed something. Please reopen if you can reproduce.

CC'ing Wassim to know if something changed there.

Although pde-ui did not submit any fixes directly related to pde-export per se,
there were concurrency problems with PDE models that were all fixed up for the 
1600 build.  So these could account for pde-build not finding the plugin.xml 
for swt.  Note that although swt was not exported explicitly, it is still 
needed by PDE-build for compilation purposes.

As for the Ant dialog that popped up, it typically comes up only if you try to 
export while another export operation is already in progress.
